Package nl.tudelft.jpacman.sprite

Interface Sprite

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AnimatedSprite, EmptySprite, ImageSprite
    public interface Sprite
    Visual representation of some object.
    Author:
    Jeroen Roosen

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void draw​(Graphics graphics, int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Draws the sprite on the provided graphics context.
      int getHeight()
      Returns the height of this sprite.
      int getWidth()
      Returns the width of this sprite.
      Sprite split​(int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Returns a portion of this sprite as a new Sprite.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        void draw​(Graphics graphics,
          int x,
          int y,
          int width,
          int height)
        Draws the sprite on the provided graphics context.
        Parameters:
        graphics - The graphics context to draw.
        x - The destination x coordinate to start drawing.
        y - The destination y coordinate to start drawing.
        width - The width of the destination draw area.
        height - The height of the destination draw area.

      • split

        Sprite split​(int x,
             int y,
             int width,
             int height)
        Returns a portion of this sprite as a new Sprite.
        Parameters:
        x - The x start coordinate.
        y - The y start coordinate.
        width - The width of the target sprite.
        height - The height of the target sprite.
        Returns:
        A new sprite of width x height, or a new EmptySprite if the region was not in the current sprite.

      • getWidth

        int getWidth()
        Returns the width of this sprite.
        Returns:
        The width in pixels.

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Returns the height of this sprite.
        Returns:
        The height of this sprite in pixels.
